content: cup of tea anyone these one inch teacups and saucers are knit entirely in the round from the top down in one piece the handle is made by stretching out a bobble - hooray for not having to sew on something so tiny to finish simply weave in any loose ends and add some steam i like using sock or fingering for mine each teacup takes me about 20 minutes i hope you enjoy they make adorable gifts i have scaled them to fit my acorn tea pot copyright 2023 version 2 october 2025 by natasha hanson all rights reserved 1 introduction teacup instructions using your teacup color cast on 10 sts divide the finished measurements stitches over 2 dpns 5 sts on both needle 1 & 2 and height 1 / 2 5cm join to work in the round round 1-3 knit approximate yardage round 4 mb knit till end of round 3 yards total this is a great scrappy project round 5-6 knit round 7 ssk k1 k2tog repeat 6 sts yarn if desired change to saucer color i use scraps of either sock or fingering for mine i find if you changed color knot the ends together and push that fingering does make my stitches look tidier them into the cup round 8 knit needles round 9 kfb repeat till end of round 12 sts one set of double-pointed needles dpns in size us 2 round 10 knit 2 75mm or desired size round 11 kfb repeat till end of round 24 sts gauge optional cast off cut yarn draw through last remaining stitch use your cast off end to tidy up the circle and weave in 8 stitches and 8 row = 1 /2 5cm over stockinette finishing notions step 1 weave in remaining ends or hide them in the small amount of stuffing/fleece for steam bottom of your cup they may need trimming pattern notes step 2 put your finger or a pen in the middle of the 3 stitch bobble bobble to stretch it out and make it look like a handle knit into the front of the next stitch then the back step 3 fill the cup with fleece or stuffing - with some then the front turning 1 stitch into 3 sticking out the top to look like hot steam turn knitting and p3 step 4 have a fairy tea party turn knitting and k3 pattern support & permission repeat these two row one more time with right side facing pass second stitch on the right for pattern support simply pm me on ravelry xox needle over the first pass the 3rd over the first now you have my permission to sell any cups you make but you are back to your original stitch count please credit me as the designer thanks video links bobbles 3 ways how to use dpns in the round how to do a kfb how to do a ssk abbreviations k = knit kfb = knit front
